page.title: 14A Famous Poet
page.content: Robert Bloomfield, author of 'The Farmer's Boy' lived locally in his early life. The cottage stands in the centre of the village close to the church, and is presently being skilfully plastered with pargetting, to make a notable feature in the village of a cottage previously uninteresting architecturally, being a simple all- brick building. Robert Bloomfield lived from 1766 to 1823, in his later years away from the village, including the period during which he wrote the famous poem. The area, with its rich farming heritage (by far the great majority of people in the village were farm labourers at the time), would have been formative inspiration for the boy as he grew up in that environment.
